SEARCH
Package via.vinylsystem.client

Class DirectoryClient

java.lang.Object
via.vinylsystem.client.DirectoryClient
public class DirectoryClient extends Object
UDP client for resolving Vinyl server IPs via the directory service.

Sends a JSON request containing the server name to the directory server over UDP and receives the corresponding IP address and TTL. Handles parsing of the directory's JSON response and converts it into a DirectoryClient.Resolve record.

Example usage: 

 DirectoryClient dir = new DirectoryClient("127.0.0.1", 4555);
 DirectoryClient.Resolve res = dir.resolveByName("Happy_music.group3.pro2");
 System.out.println(res.ip() + " TTL=" + res.ttlSec());

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ghiyath invalid input: '&' sakariae

  • Constructor Details

    • DirectoryClient

      public DirectoryClient(String directoryHost, int directoryUdpPort) throws UnknownHostException
      Constructs a new DirectoryClient.
      Parameters:
      directoryHost - hostname or IP of the directory server
      directoryUdpPort - UDP port of the directory server
      Throws:
      UnknownHostException - if the hostname cannot be resolved

  • Method Details

    • resolveByName

      public DirectoryClient.Resolve resolveByName(String name)
      Resolves a server name to its IP address and TTL via the directory server.

      Sends a JSON request over UDP and expects a JSON response containing the server's IP, TTL, and confirmed name. Throws an exception if the directory responds with an error or no IP is provided.

      Parameters:
      name - the server name to resolve
      Returns:
      a DirectoryClient.Resolve record containing the resolved server info
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if a socket or I/O error occurs
